title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:04 <@sdumitriu> Yes kutuzovas  
00:07 <Mondstrahl> has joined #xwiki  
00:07 <Mondstrahl> Morning =)  
00:29 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: do we have some conf that is set from xwiki admin interface and written in xwiki.cfs or xwiki.proprieties ?  
00:29 <@sdumitriu> For what?  
00:29 <+sburjan`> i was thinking we add field for open office  
00:30 <@sdumitriu> I'm not sure I understand what you mean, but it's not possible to change xwiki.properties or xwiki.cfg from the wiki  
00:30 <+sburjan`> or somehow to improve the auto-detect mechanism of the soffice .. because it really sucks atm  
00:30 <@sdumitriu> We only change wiki documents  
00:30 <@sdumitriu> The solution isn't to write back to xwiki.properties, but to define the configuration in the wiki  
00:31 <+sburjan`> best scenario would be to auto-detect where is the executable  
00:31 <+sburjan`> and AFAIK there was a lib that supposed to do that, but it seems it doesn't (at least on ubuntu)  
00:32 <+sburjan`> I mean.. modifying manually xwiki.cgf only as a last resort or to force a path  
00:32 <Mondstrahl> Good n8  
00:32 <Mondstrahl> has left #xwiki  
00:43 <kutuzovas> i'm trying to modify the registration page and i am having some dificulties  
00:43 <kutuzovas> #set($newDoc = $xwiki.getDocument("DEKC.$name"))  
00:43 <kutuzovas> doesnt work  
00:43 <kutuzovas> tried it with DEKC.${name}  
00:44 <kutuzovas> also doest work  
00:44 <kutuzovas> is the $name the right value for the username value that is being registered?  
00:45 <@sdumitriu> kutuzovas: Try ${request.name}  
00:45 <@sdumitriu> If you want to get paramters from the request, use $request  
00:49 <kutuzovas> hmm  
00:49 <kutuzovas> its something else  
00:49 <kutuzovas> i'm modifying the xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/Registration?editor=wiki page  
00:56 <sdumitriu> has quit  
01:04 <kutuzovas> can it be because the values are not there yet when the code is loaded?  
01:46 <kutuzovas> cjdelisle: on a page when i am loged on with admin i see the values and not variables, when i am loged in with a normal user i see variables  
01:47 <kutuzovas> is that because the normal user doesnt have programing rights?

07:41 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hi  
07:53 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
07:55 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : hey can you suggest a simple issue  could work on that would help me understand the context i would need for the project  
07:56 <@cjdelisle> You want to fix a bug so that you can get a better idea of what we are dealing with?  
07:56 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : yeah  
07:56 <pulasthi> :)  
07:56 <@cjdelisle> lemme see what's on the tracker  
07:58 <bbc581> has quit  
08:00 <@cjdelisle> argh, ff is slow  
08:01 <pulasthi> :)  
08:02 <pulasthi> btw should i put a mail to the devs list stating what i would like to do i mean about the project  
08:04 <@cjdelisle> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=project+%3D+%27XWIKI%27+and+type+%3D+Bug+and+resolution+%3D+unresolved+and+component+%3D+%27storage%27&runQuery=true&clear=true  
08:04 <@cjdelisle> I'm looking at these, unfortunately the reason why storage bugs sit on the tracker is usually because they are unreasonbly difficult to fix.  
08:05 <pulasthi> ahh :/  
08:06 <@cjdelisle> Right now I have to finish getting a laptop setup for my mom and then I can get to work on this full time.  
08:06 <pulasthi> k so about the mail to the devs list should i put it :)  
08:07 <@cjdelisle> Are you good at starting on a line and reading as the code executes  
08:07 <@cjdelisle> IE "following the line of execution"?  
08:08 <pulasthi> hmm you mean tracing back the path the code executes  
08:08 <@cjdelisle> yup  
08:08 <pulasthi> hmm i think so done that a lot  
08:08 <pulasthi> :)  
08:08 <@cjdelisle> If you can do that then you should be able to understand the storage code just be reading it.  
08:08 <@cjdelisle> Start at XWiki.java#getDocument()  
08:09 <pulasthi> k  
08:09 <pulasthi> its in the platfrom right  
08:09 <@cjdelisle> yes  
08:09 <@cjdelisle> you have git-cloned the git repository?  
08:09 <pulasthi> k will do :)  
08:09 <pulasthi> yep  
08:09 <@cjdelisle> you are using linux?  
08:09 <pulasthi> ya  
08:10 <@cjdelisle> find ./ -name 'XWiki.java'  
08:10 <@cjdelisle> and there are 2, it's \_not\_ the one in /api/  
08:10 <pulasthi> ahh ok  
08:11 <@cjdelisle> any questions, just ask  
08:11 <pulasthi> :)  
08:11 <pulasthi> thanks ill keep in touch  
08:11 <@cjdelisle> hint: it goes from XWiki.java to XWikiCacheStore.java then to XWikiHibernateStore.java  
08:12 <pulasthi> k ill let u knw if i get any issues  
08:13 <pulasthi> btw do i have to learn velocity  
08:13 <pulasthi> and groovy a lot  
08:13 <@cjdelisle> not really for this project  
08:13 <pulasthi> ahh great  
08:13 <pulasthi> :)  
08:13 <@cjdelisle> it's easy though, it's basicly a subset of java  
08:14 <pulasthi> ya i went though groovy a bit  
08:31 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
09:47 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <abusenius> has quit  
10:31 <Mondstrahl> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <Mondstrahl> Hello  
10:32 <@cjdelisle> hi  
10:32 <Mondstrahl> How can i hide some text in the xwiki sytax (use it as "comment")  
10:32 <Mondstrahl> ?  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> that is on the todo list for xwiki syntax 2.1 (AFAIK) right now you can use a velocity macro and comment out the content of that.  
10:33 <@cjdelisle> The performance will take a hit but it will work  
10:34 <@cjdelisle> {{velocity}}#\*  lalalalala you can't see this    \*#{{/velocity}}  
10:34 <@cjdelisle> maybe we should introduce a comment macro for the time being.  
10:35 <Mondstrahl> Thank you, cjdelisle  
10:35 <@cjdelisle> sure thing

16:29 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: WDYT about configuring the maven-compiler-plugin for the release profile with:  
16:30 <@sdumitriu>         <configuration>  
16:30 <@sdumitriu>           <debug>false</debug>  
16:30 <@sdumitriu>           <debuglevel>none</debuglevel>  
16:30 <@sdumitriu>           <optimize>true</optimize>  
16:30 <@sdumitriu>         </configuration>  
16:32 <vmassol> I think it's useful to have debug info for profilers. I'm not sure they make a lot o difference (never had to do this in the past)  
16:32 <vmassol> basically I don't enough about the pros to have an informed opinion  
16:32 <vmassol> s/don't/don't know/  
16:32 <vmassol> you could send a mail on the devs list  
16:33 <vmassol> with some explanations about the pros (links)  
16:33 <@sdumitriu> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4218721/optimizing-java-compiler-during-a-maven-build  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> The only pro is the reduced jar size  
16:35 <vmassol> I don't have time to read right now  
16:35 <vmassol> but if it's only that then I'm not sure it's enough  
16:35 <vmassol> I'm still on the jgroups debugging

22:00 <cjde1isle> has quit  
22:25 <arbaciauskas> has joined #xwiki  
22:25 <arbaciauskas> hello  
22:25 <@sdumitriu> Hi  
22:25 <arbaciauskas> I have a question. How to get the date from class property, not as a string  
22:26 <arbaciauskas> because as i understand $datatool.getDate()  
22:26 <arbaciauskas> also gets not a string but date  
22:26 <arbaciauskas> i need this for comparing  
22:26 <arbaciauskas> two dates  
22:26 <@sdumitriu> So you're using something like $obj.get('dateprop'), right?  
22:27 <arbaciauskas> yes  
22:27 <@sdumitriu> You should use $obj.getProperty('dateprop').value  
22:27 <arbaciauskas> #set($data1 = $doc.getObject('DEKC.KursasClass').getProperty('Prasideda').value)  
22:27 <@sdumitriu> Hm, that should already return a date  
22:27 <@sdumitriu> $data1.class says what?  
22:27 <arbaciauskas> well it does return a date  
22:28 <arbaciauskas> but when i compare them  
22:28 <arbaciauskas> using if statement  
22:28 <@sdumitriu> How do you compare?  
22:28 <arbaciauskas> it doesnt give the naswer  
22:28 <arbaciauskas> $date1>$date2  
22:28 <arbaciauskas> or maybe there's command for comparing dates?  
22:29 <@sdumitriu> Try $date1.after($date2)  
22:30 <arbaciauskas> is it boolean?  
22:30 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
22:33 <arbaciauskas> so if this statement is true, it means date1 is a bigger date than date2?  
22:33 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
22:33 <arbaciauskas> like 2011 and 2010  
22:33 <@sdumitriu> date1 is after date2  
22:34 <arbaciauskas> hmm  
22:34 <arbaciauskas> i get opposite  
22:34 <arbaciauskas> 2011-06-15 00:00:00.0 2011-05-05 23:31:54  
22:34 <arbaciauskas> i get that the second date is after the first one  
22:35 <@sdumitriu> Are both variables dates?  
22:35 <arbaciauskas> the frst one is the value from a class  
22:36 <arbaciauskas> and the other one is current got with $datatool.get()  
22:39 <arbaciauskas> could be because the first value has like miliseconds?  
22:39 <arbaciauskas> in the class properties i made the date format to be only y m d  
22:39 <arbaciauskas> but when i get the value it comes with h m s ms  
22:44 <@sdumitriu> http://velocity.apache.org/tools/releases/1.4/javadoc/org/apache/velocity/tools/generic/DateTool.html#get%28java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String%29  
22:44 <@sdumitriu> You should use $datetool.getDate() instead  
22:50 <arbaciauskas> works!  
22:50 <arbaciauskas> thank you  
22:50 <arbaciauskas> the best part it doesnt need to formated  
22:50 <arbaciauskas> to be\*  
22:52 <sdumitriu> has quit  
23:19 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki
